wikipedia_page.main: Ralph Hush (1779 – 2 June 1860) was a convict sent from Northumberland to Australia in 1820. He was also one of the first convicts ever to receive a pardon from a life sentence after less than 5 years.

response: *Ralph Hush (1783–1860), English convict sent to Australia
* Sophia Matilda Eipper (1843–1915), married William Ralph Hush, grandson of Ralph Hush, in 1865 in Braidwood.
* Ralph Hush (1779–1860), convict sent to Australia

response: * Ralph Hush (1779–1860), English farmer, transported to New South Wales for theft
